name: Hotel Ariane

reviews.text: This was my second visit to the Ariane Hotel and once again it did not disappoint. I was travelling with a large group of bandsmen and supporters from New Zealand for the ANZAC Ceremonies. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff of this hotel as they accommodated us so graciously with our many and varied requirements, such as allowing us to rehearse in the hotel and store many large instruments. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting this area of Belgium. It is situated in an excellent location. Restaurant is excellent and rooms are very comfortable and clean. Will definitely return in the future. The only very small downside would be the cost of Wi Fi but that did not trouble us too much.
reviews.title: Excellent Return Visit

reviews.text: we always book this hotel if we can, good sized rooms, first class service from friendly staff, they have over the past 10 years that we have been staying here maintained the highest standards in everything they do. The restaurant is very good and the weekly menu of the day is excellent value.
reviews.title: I love this place

reviews.text: Well located in the centre of Ypres. Rooms comfortable. Only gripe is that in the age of free internet, they insist in charging. Enough to make me consider a different hotel. Breakfasts were very good and beds comfortable
reviews.title: A good four star hotel, but lacks any character

reviews.text: We stayed here to visit the battlefields and were delighted with the hotel. It is well situated near the centre but in a quiet spot with very friendly and helpful staff. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast was excellent. We also ate in the restaurant one night which, although not cheap, was very good indeed. Highly recommended
reviews.title: Very clean and comfortable
A lovely hotel.
reviews.text: I was a little worried about booking a hotel that came up in first position following my google hotel search in Ypres but I needn't have been. It met all our expectations and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. The reception staff were so polite and helpful, the rooms modern and comfortable, the food delicious. Will definitely return.

reviews.title: Memorable and good
reviews.text: We had a brief stay here after visiting the Pheasant Wood cemetery. It is good with a good restaurant . There is free parking, walking distance to the Menin Gate and hire bicycles. Rooms are modern and staff friendly. Also, for us after a while in France it was good to get reliable water pressure and temperature in showers and a decent , modern elevator system. We loved it!

I stayed in this hotel for two nights during some research into tracing the war experience of my grandparents. There hotel is located very close to the centre of Ieper, even though it appears you are driving into a business park. There is good parking outside the hotel and no steps into the hotel which makes it easy to carry luggage. The reception is in a large atrium with good natural light, the receptionists were very polite (excellent English) and helped me out when I broke my travel adapter. The rooms are a reasonable size, mine was modern in outlook and the bathroom was very clean and the shower very good. We enjoyed the included breakfast both mornings, we ate once in the afternoon and was surprised by the speed and quality of the food. The hotel seems very popular with locals to eat for lunch and dinner, which is always a good sign. The bar in the evening was quiet, although we always returned pretty late so it might of been livelier early in the evening. However with so may places to visit & eat in Ieper and the surrounding villages it is more of a base of operations. Very pleased with the hotel choice and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel and a Great Base for WW1 Research

reviews.text: I stayed here for three nights in May 2011, for a family reunion and to visit some of the surrounding WW1 sites.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, good value for money

reviews.text: Good points: Nice, spacious reception area with comfortable seats, very friendly staff, good restaurant, excellent breakfast included in the price of the room. The room itself (301) was spacious and comfortable and, being on the third floor and in a very quiet area, it was possible to sleep with the window open.
reviews.title: Relaxed professional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One or two minor grumbles: The breakfast room is quite cramped with very little room between tables to get to the buffet. There was a pervasive and unpleasant smell of cooking in the third floor corridor in the late afternoon and early evening (my room was above the kitchen, I think). And finally, when you have a single bed and a duvet that is only 5 centimetres wider than the bed itself, it's inevitable that you will lose the duvet every time you turn over in bed !
reviews.title: Comfortable and well located

reviews.text: This hotel really hits the spot, its clean, stylish, convenient, the rooms are cosy, the breakfast and bar busy but efficient. It seems to process the majority of battlefield tour visitors efficiently and warmly. Would not hesitiate to recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: very well done

reviews.text: Sometimes expectations exceed the experience, but with the Ariane our expectations were surpassed. Stayed in a "prestige" (family) room with our two young teenagers. There was plenty of space, a huge bathroom and proper beds for the kids. It was really quiet and the beds superbly comfortable. Breakfast was amazing; fresh fruit, delicious pastries, wonderful bread, eggs, bacon or cereal - so much choice. Reception staff were very helpful and informative - nothing was too much trouble. The rooms including breakfast room, bedrooms, gardens and bar areas were all spotlessly clean. The WWI memorabilia in the lobby and stair wells was well presented and interesting. Big, free car park too. Then of course there's the location - Ypres centre is just a 5 minute walk, which means you have access to everything and none of the late night noise. Would definitely go back and would strongly recommend this hotel to others.
reviews.title: Can't get better in Ypres

reviews.text: What a fantastic country, friendly, clean and orderly. Travelled on the 'Pride of York' overnight out of Hull and it was a forty minute drive to the hotel. Even though we were too early to check in, there was plenty of room in the car park and we went on a little walking tour of Ypres until around 2.30pm when we returned to the hotel for a cold drink and a lie down. Ate in the Ariane both evenings and were charmed by the small details and food presentation (small jars of advocaat and tiny cake served with coffee).
reviews.title: Special Belgian Break.

reviews.text: Decor is minimalist and extremely clean, beds comfortable and plenty of room!
reviews.title: Comfortable, clean and great breakfast!

reviews.text: Breakfast plentiful and varied - small gripe that although crockery is Villeroy and Boch, there were chips on several items we used.
reviews.title: Ariane, Ypres

reviews.text: I could write a book, but it easier to say it was all absolutely excellent!!
reviews.title: Excellent, came up to all expectations!!

reviews.text: We stayed here at Easter touring the battlefields and for a day visit to Bruges. The staff were very friendly and the level of service consistently good. The hotel is in a very quiet spot only a few minutes walk to the town centre and the station.
reviews.title: Lovely, friendly hotel

reviews.text: Thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: The reviews are accurate

reviews.text: A very nice facility. Very nice staff. Was there on a cycling tour with a group and has one mean in the restaurant and it was first rate as well. Plus easy walking access to town center.
reviews.title: Wonderful service & food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent the Easter weekend meeting friends and visiting Ypres in Belgium. Even though the weather was pretty poor, the service and friendliness of the staff made up for this and made it a wonderful weekend. They even booked a vet for my dog prior to my return to the UK. The food is no more expensive than the rest of Ieper or Ypres but it is of much better quality and presentation. The rooms are modern and a reasonable size and it is located well for the Market Square, the Menin Gate and all of the sights.
reviews.title: The staff are at the heart of this hotel

description: Family-run Ariane Hotel: welcome to quiet green surroundings in a historical rich town. Not quite in the city centre, but definetely near enough to discover our beautifull town by foot. A warm welcome, sunny terrace surrounded by gardens, pleasant conservatory, tastefully decorated bedrooms with all modern comfort and an immaculate service. Ariane Hotel truely has everything to please, the ideal destination for lovers of culinairy enjoyment and holiday makers looking for rest and comfort.
